description: Number of different symbols needed to express n as a Roman numeral.
comments: Sequence created using classic Roman numerals, i.e. 99 = XCIX, not the questionable IC.a(n) = a043537(A061493(n)). - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Apr 14 2013
links: Nathaniel Johnston, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..3999
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Roman Numerals
example: a(97) = 4 as you need I, V, X and C to express XCVII
maple: with(StringTools): A057226 := proc(n) local r: r:=convert(n, roman): return `if`(Search("I",r)>0,1,0) + `if`(Search("V",r)>0,1,0) + `if`(Search("X",r)>0,1,0) + `if`(Search("L",r)>0,1,0) + `if`(Search("C",r)>0,1,0) + `if`(Search("D",r)>0,1,0) + `if`(Search("M",r)>0,1,0): end: seq(A057226(n), n=1..105); # Nathaniel Johnston, May 18 2011
author: Helge T. Blohmer (crusher(AT)k-town.de), Sep 19 2000
